sentence.Network_en: I was hungry, and, more importantly, my children were hungry.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很饿，更重要的是，我的孩子们很饿。

sentence.Network_en: This controversy was expected to figure importantly in their discussion.
sentence.Network_cn: 预计这一争论将在他们的讨论中占重要位置.

sentence.Network_en: Most importantly, Americans vote for officials who set economic policy.
sentence.Network_cn: 尤其重要的是, 美国人可以通过投票选举官员来决定经济政策.

there is no question that peace and order will be restored and more importantly , Xinjiang will never be separated from the People's Republic of China on either racial or religious ground .豪无疑问，和平和次序恢复将得到恢复，更重要的事，新疆不会在种族和宗教领域从中华人民共合国中分离出去。

entry.tran: 重要的;必要的;非常有价值的
entry.def: Something that is important is very significant, is highly valued, or is necessary.

example.ex: Her sons are the most important thing in her life...
example.tran: 她生命中最重要的是她的儿子们。

example.ex: The planned general strike represents an important economic challenge to the government...
example.tran: 这场有计划的总罢工是政府面临的一个重大经济挑战。

entry.tran: 有声望的;有影响的;显要的
entry.def: Someone who is important has influence or power within a society or a particular group.

example.ex: He was the most important person on the island.
example.tran: 他是岛上最有声望的人。

example.ex: ...an important figure in the media world.
example.tran: 传媒界很有影响力的人物

means.word_mean: 1. in an important way or to an important degree;

sentences.sentence: "more importantly, Weber held that the manifold meaning attached to the event by the social scientist could alter his definition of the concrete event itself"
"for centuries jellies have figured importantly among English desserts, particularly upon festive occasion"
